data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Facing forward will set you on the path to going forward. Becoming right will set you on the path to going left. Being backward will set you on the path to going backward. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You cannot go back to the starting point if you are already back. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Take 6 steps to go back to starting point. Take 4 steps to turn around. Take 10 steps to return to starting point. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 7 steps. Take 1 step. Take 7 steps. Turn left. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn left. It returns to the start point. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 10 steps. Turn left. Turn left. Take 9 steps. Take 3 steps. Take 3 steps. Turn around. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn around and walk 3 steps, turn around and make 10 steps back. Just because you take 5 steps does not mean you will go back to the starting point. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn left. Turn right. Take 7 steps. Turn around. Take 7 steps. Turn right. Turn left. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turning right 7 times will return you to where you started. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 8 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn right. Turn right. Take 8 steps. Take 9 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn right. The first number would be 8, the second would be 9. The second number would then add up to 8, and the third would add up to 9. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Turn around. Take 8 steps. Take 2 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If we take 6 steps, we are at the start point. 8 = the number of steps that turn around and the next 6 steps are turning around. If you take 2 steps, you are back at the starting point. So, the answer is yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step left. Take 4 steps forward. Take 6 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you return to the starting point, you will need to complete the instruction to go back. So, the answer is yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 3 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn around. Take 2 steps. Take 7 steps. Take 3 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You would not get back to the starting point while taking 9 steps. You would return to the starting point after taking 2 steps and 7 steps. So, the answer is yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step backward. Take 1 step backward. Take 1 step backward. Take 3 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You cannot take 1 step backwards if you are facing forward. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 6 steps backward. Take 8 steps right. Take 1 step backward. Take 5 steps left. Take 2 steps left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

At first you are facing forward, but you quickly start to turn around to the right. To get back home in two steps, you must go left at first, then immediately turn right. To get back in three steps, you must first take 6 steps backward at first, then immediately turn right. Now you are facing the same direction as before, so in three steps, you must go first either left or right at first, then slowly backward at first. Thus, the answer is no.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps left. Take 3 steps left. Take 1 step left. Take 3 steps backward. Take 6 steps left. Take 3 steps forward. Take 4 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
There are 2 ways to return to the starting point. The first way is to always face forward. The second is to continue walking forward and then the third way is to walk backward. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 4 steps left. Take 3 steps forward. Take 1 step right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
To return to the starting point, you must go back in one direction only, and never face any direction. So, the answer is yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 3 steps right. Take 1 step backward. Take 6 steps left. Take 1 step forward. Take 3 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Once the instructions are completed, all you need to do is 1 step forward. So, the answer is yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn right. Turn right. Turn around. Turn left. Take 4 steps. Take 10 steps. Take 8 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Since you had 4 steps to go and turn around, you must turn left and return to the starting point. So, the answer is yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 10 steps. Turn around. Take 9 steps. Take 10 steps. Turn around. Take 3 steps. Take 6 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If you take the direction change back to when you started, you would repeat the following sequence: Take 10 steps. Turn around take 4 steps. Take 3 steps. Take 6 steps return to the starting point. Thus, the answer is Yes.

If you take 8 steps, you can only go 8 steps. That number is the same for all the different directions except turn around, go around, and turn right. So, the answer is Yes.

When you turn around, you are returning to the starting point. So, the answer is yes.

The first step in the given sequence is 1 step forward. The second step in this sequence is 7 steps left. The final step in this sequence is 5 steps forward. So, the answer is No.

Turn left and take 6 steps before turning right again. So, the answer is Yes.

As long as the starting point is in the same place that you started in, you have to always make sure you are returning from the starting point. So, the answer is yes.

If you take 3, 7, and 10 steps, you will end up back in the starting point. So, the answer is no.

Recap: Front Front  5  5  , 6    5,  back  5   back'   5,  forward  7, 7 , 2,'back  5,  left''  right    7, 7, 5   back'    back     . So, the answer is Yes.

Take one of the nine steps in the direction you want to go. If you turn around you will be going back to the starting point. So, the answer is yes.

If you always face forward, you will be moving forward until you arrive at the starting point. You start the sequence by facing in the direction you start so you always start from the starting point. If you try to face backward, you can't return to the starting point. So, the answer is No.

Take 8 steps left. Take 8 steps left. Return to start. Thus, the answer is Yes.

Take 1 step backward in the first step. Take 6 steps backward in the second step. Take 4 steps backward in the third step. To change one item to another item is to take another step. The same process can be done in several ways. If you took 5 steps to change 5 items you were moving up 5 steps. If you took 7 steps to change 7 items you were moving up 7 steps. So, the answer is Yes.

Your step forward and backward motions reverse every step. So, you cannot take 8 steps backwards and backward. And then you take 10 steps forward and get back to the previous one. So, the answer is yes.

If you always face forward, you can always take 7 steps backward. If you always face forward, you can always take 4 steps forward. Those are the same steps.. So, the answer is Yes.
